annotationProperties.description: A dictionary of OWL annotation properties key : label; value : short form id

annotations.description: A list, each member of which is a printf_annotation

base_IRI.description: Specifies the base IRI to be used to generate new classes.

classes.description: A dictionary of OWL classes. key :label; value : short form id

dataProperties.description: A dictionary of OWL data properties key : label; value : short form id

data_vars.description: A dictionary of variables ranging over OWL data-types. Key = variable name, value = variable range specified as a valid OWL data-type.

description.description: A free text description of the pattern.  Must be UTF-8 encoded.

naming_fields.description: A list of annotation properties used as naming fields, in order of preference.

objectProperties.description: A dictionary of OWL object properties. key : label; value : short form id

owl_axioms.description: A list, each member of which is a printf_annotation

pattern_name.description: The name of the pattern.  This must be an ASCII string with no spaces.  The only special characters allowed are '_' and '-'.   By convention, this is used as the file name of the pattern - with an appropriate extension.

relations.description: A dictionary of OWL object properties. key : label; value : short form id

vars.description: A dictionary of variables ranging over OWL classes.   Key = variable name, value = variable range as manchester syntax string.

printf.description: A UTF-8 encoded printf format string.

annotationProperty.description: A string corresponding to the rdfs:label of an owl annotation property.   If the annotation property has no label,  the shortForm ID should be used.  The annotation property must be listed in the annotation property dictionary.

vars.description: An ordered list of variables for substitution into the accompanying print format string.  Each entry must correspond to the name of a variable specified in either the 'vars' field or the data_var  field of the pattern. Where an OWL entity is specified, the label fo the OWL entity should be used in the substitution.

printf_manchester.description: A UTF-8 encoded printf format string.

axiom_type.description: OWL axiom type expressed as manchester syntax: equivalentTo, subClassOf, disjointWith.   GCI  - for general class inclusion axioms, is also valid (although missing from manchester syntax.)   This specifies the axiom type to be generated from the text following substitution.

text.description: A print format string in OWL Manchester syntax.  Each entry must correspond to an entry in o the name of a var in  the var field of the pattern. Entries in single quotes must correspond to the labels of entries in  owl_entity dictionaries (classes, relations, dataProperties)

vars.description: An ordered list of variables for substitution into the accompanying print format string.  Each entry must correspond to the name of a var in the var field of the pattern."
